verses.verse: Now king<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010> loved<WH157> many<WH7227> foreign<WH5237> women,<WH802> together with the daughter<WH1323> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> women of the Moabites,<WH4125> Ammonites,<WH5984> Edomites,<WH130> Sidonians,<WH6722> and Hittites;<WH2850>

of the nations<WH1471> concerning which Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to the children<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> "You shall not go among<WH935> them,<WH935> neither shall they come among you;<WH403> for surely they will turn away<WH5186> your heart<WH3824> after<WH310> their gods.<WH430>" Solomon<WH8010> joined<WH1692> to these in love.<WH157>
He had seven<WH7651> hundred<WH3967> wives,<WH802> princesses,<WH8282> and three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> concubines;<WH6370> and his wives<WH802> turned away<WH5186> his heart.<WH3820>

For it happened,<WH6256> when Solomon<WH8010> was old,<WH2209> that his wives<WH802> turned away<WH5186> his heart<WH3824> after<WH310> other<WH312> gods;<WH430> and his heart<WH3824> was not perfect<WH8003> with Yahweh<WH3068> his God,<WH430> as was the heart<WH3824> of David<WH1732> his father.<WH1>
For Solomon<WH8010> went<WH3212> after<WH310> Ashtoreth<WH6253> the goddess<WH430> of the Sidonians,<WH6722> and after<WH310> Milcom<WH4445> the abomination<WH8251> of the Ammonites.<WH5984>
Solomon<WH8010> did<WH6213> that which was evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and didn't<WH4390> go fully after<WH310> Yahweh,<WH3068> as did David<WH1732> his father.<WH1>

Then Solomon<WH8010> built<WH1129> a high place<WH1116> for Chemosh<WH3645> the abomination<WH8251> of Moab,<WH4124> on the mountain<WH2022> that is before<WH6440> Jerusalem,<WH3389> and for Molech<WH4432> the abomination<WH8251> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon.<WH5983>
So he did<WH6213> for all his foreign<WH5237> wives,<WH802> who burnt incense<WH6999> and sacrificed<WH2076> to their gods.<WH430>

Yahweh<WH3068> was angry<WH599> with Solomon,<WH8010> because his heart<WH3824> was turned<WH5186> away from Yahweh,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> who had appeared<WH7200> to him twice,<WH6471>

and had commanded<WH6680> him concerning this thing,<WH1697> that he should not go<WH3212> after<WH310> other<WH312> gods:<WH430> but he didn't<WH8104> keep that which Yahweh<WH3068> commanded.<WH6680>

Therefore Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to Solomon,<WH8010> "Because this is done by you,<WH8104> and you have not kept my covenant<WH1285> and my statutes,<WH2708> which I have commanded<WH6680> you,<WH7167> I will surely tear<WH7167> the kingdom<WH4467> from you,<WH5414> and will give it to your servant.<WH5650>
Notwithstanding I will not do<WH6213> it in your days,<WH3117> for David<WH1732> your father<WH1>'s sake;<WH7167> but I will tear it out of the hand<WH3027> of your son.<WH1121>

However<WH7535> I will not tear away<WH7167> all the kingdom;<WH4467> but I will give<WH5414> one<WH259> tribe<WH7626> to your son,<WH1121> for David<WH1732> my servant<WH5650>'s sake,<WH3389> and for Jerusalem's sake which I have chosen.<WH977>"
Yahweh<WH3068> raised up<WH6965> an adversary<WH7854> to Solomon,<WH8010> Hadad<WH1908> the Edomite:<WH130> he was of the king<WH4428>'s seed<WH2233> in Edom.<WH123>

For it happened,<WH1732> when David was in Edom,<WH123> and Joab<WH3097> the captain<WH8269> of the army<WH6635> was gone up<WH5927> to bury<WH6912> the slain,<WH2491> and had struck<WH2491> every male<WH2145> in Edom<WH123>
(for Joab<WH3097> and all Israel<WH3478> remained<WH3427> there six<WH8337> months,<WH2320> until he had cut off<WH3772> every male<WH2145> in Edom<WH123>);

that Hadad<WH111> fled,<WH1272> he and certain<WH582> Edomites<WH130> of his father<WH1>'s servants<WH5650> with him,<WH935> to go into Egypt,<WH4714> Hadad<WH1908> being yet a little<WH6996> child.<WH5288>

They arose<WH6965> out of Midian,<WH4080> and came<WH935> to Paran;<WH6290> and they took<WH3947> men<WH582> with them out of Paran,<WH6290> and they came<WH935> to Egypt,<WH4714> to Pharaoh<WH6547> king<WH4428> of Egypt,<WH4714> who gave<WH5414> him a house,<WH1004> and appointed<WH559> him food,<WH3899> and gave<WH5414> him land.<WH776>

Hadad<WH1908> found<WH4672> great<WH3966> favor<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> so that he gave<WH5414> him as wife<WH802> the sister<WH269> of his own wife,<WH802> the sister<WH269> of Tahpenes<WH8472> the queen.<WH1377>

The sister<WH269> of Tahpenes<WH8472> bore<WH3205> him Genubath<WH1592> his son,<WH1121> whom Tahpenes<WH8472> weaned<WH1580> in<WH8432> Pharaoh<WH6547>'s house;<WH1004> and Genubath<WH1592> was in Pharaoh<WH6547>'s house<WH1004> among<WH8432> the sons<WH1121> of Pharaoh.<WH6547>

When Hadad<WH1908> heard<WH8085> in Egypt<WH4714> that David<WH1732> slept<WH7901> with his fathers,<WH1> and that Joab<WH3097> the captain<WH8269> of the army<WH6635> was dead,<WH4191> Hadad<WH1908> said<WH559> to Pharaoh,<WH6547> "Let me depart,<WH7971> that I may go<WH3212> to my own country.<WH776>"

Then Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to him,<WH2638> "But what have you lacked with me,<WH1245> that behold, you seek to go<WH3212> to your own country?<WH776>" He answered,<WH559> "Nothing,<WH7971> however only let me depart.<WH7971>"
God<WH430> raised up<WH6965> an adversary<WH7854> to him,<WH7331> Rezon the son<WH1121> of Eliada,<WH450> who had fled<WH1272> from his lord<WH113> Hadadezer<WH1909> king<WH4428> of Zobah.<WH6678>

He gathered<WH6908> men<WH582> to him,<WH8269> and became captain over a troop,<WH1416> when David<WH1732> killed<WH2026> them of Zobah:<WH3212> and they went to Damascus,<WH1834> and lived<WH3427> therein,<WH4427> and reigned in Damascus.<WH1834>

He was an adversary<WH7854> to Israel<WH3478> all the days<WH3117> of Solomon,<WH8010> besides the mischief<WH7451> of Hadad:<WH1908> and he abhorred<WH6973> Israel,<WH3478> and reigned<WH4427> over Syria.<WH758>

Jeroboam<WH3379> the son<WH1121> of Nebat,<WH5028> an Ephraimite<WH673> of Zeredah,<WH6868> a servant<WH5650> of Solomon,<WH8010> whose mother<WH517>'s name<WH8034> was Zeruah,<WH6871> a<WH802> widow,<WH490> he also lifted up<WH7311> his hand<WH3027> against the king.<WH4428>

This was the reason<WH1697> why he lifted up<WH7311> his hand<WH3027> against the king:<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010> built<WH1129> Millo,<WH4407> and repaired<WH5462> the breach of the city<WH5892> of David<WH1732> his father.<WH1>

The man<WH376> Jeroboam<WH3379> was a mighty man<WH376> of valor;<WH2428> and Solomon<WH8010> saw<WH7200> the young man<WH5288> that he was industrious,<WH6213> and he put him in charge<WH6485> of all the labor<WH5447> of the house<WH1004> of Joseph.<WH3130>

It happened at that time,<WH6256> when Jeroboam<WH3379> went out<WH3318> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> that the prophet<WH5030> Ahijah<WH281> the Shilonite<WH7888> found<WH4672> him in the way;<WH1870> now Ahijah had clad<WH3680> himself with a new<WH2319> garment;<WH8008> and they two<WH8147> were alone in the field.<WH7704>
Ahijah<WH281> laid hold<WH8610> of the new<WH2319> garment<WH8008> that was on him,<WH7167> and tore it in twelve<WH8147> pieces.<WH7168>

He said<WH559> to Jeroboam,<WH3379> "Take<WH3947> ten<WH6235> pieces;<WH7168> for thus says<WH559> Yahweh,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> <WH7167> 'Behold, I will tear the kingdom<WH4467> out of the hand<WH3027> of Solomon,<WH8010> and will give<WH5414> ten<WH6235> tribes to you<WH7626>

(but he shall have one<WH259> tribe,<WH7626> for my servant<WH5650> David<WH1732>'s sake and for Jerusalem<WH3389>'s sake,<WH5892> the city which I have chosen<WH977> out of all the tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478>);

because that they have forsaken<WH5800> me,<WH7812> and have worshiped Ashtoreth<WH6253> the goddess<WH430> of the Sidonians,<WH6722> Chemosh<WH3645> the god<WH430> of Moab,<WH4124> and Milcom<WH4445> the god<WH430> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon.<WH5983> They have not walked<WH1980> in my ways,<WH1870> to do<WH6213> that which is right<WH3477> in my eyes,<WH5869> and to keep my statutes<WH2708> and my ordinances,<WH4941> as David<WH1732> his father did.<WH1>

<WH3947>"'However I will not take the whole kingdom<WH4467> out of his hand;<WH3027> but I will make<WH7896> him prince<WH5387> all the days<WH3117> of his life,<WH2416> for David<WH1732> my servant<WH5650>'s sake whom I chose,<WH977> who kept<WH8104> my commandments<WH4687> and my statutes;<WH2708>
but I will take<WH3947> the kingdom<WH4410> out of his son<WH1121>'s hand,<WH3027> and will give<WH5414> it to you,<WH6235> even ten tribes.<WH7626>

To his son<WH1121> will I give<WH5414> one<WH259> tribe,<WH7626> that David<WH1732> my servant<WH5650> may have a lamp<WH5216> always<WH3117> before<WH6440> me in Jerusalem,<WH3389> the city<WH5892> which I have chosen<WH977> me to put<WH7760> my name there.<WH8034>
I will take<WH3947> you,<WH4427> and you shall reign according to all that your soul<WH5315> desires,<WH183> and shall be king<WH4428> over Israel.<WH3478>

It shall be,<WH8085> if you will listen to all that I command<WH6680> you,<WH1980> and will walk in my ways,<WH1870> and do<WH6213> that which is right<WH3477> in my eyes,<WH5869> to keep<WH8104> my statutes<WH2708> and my commandments,<WH4687> as David<WH1732> my servant<WH5650> did;<WH6213> that I will be with you,<WH1129> and will build you a sure<WH539> house,<WH1004> as I built<WH1129> for David,<WH1732> and will give<WH5414> Israel to you.<WH3478>
I will for this afflict<WH6031> the seed<WH2233> of David,<WH1732> but not forever.<WH3117>'"

Solomon<WH8010> sought<WH1245> therefore to kill<WH4191> Jeroboam;<WH3379> but Jeroboam<WH3379> arose,<WH6965> and fled<WH1272> into Egypt,<WH4714> to Shishak<WH7895> king<WH4428> of Egypt,<WH4714> and was in Egypt<WH4714> until the death<WH4194> of Solomon.<WH8010>

Now the rest<WH3499> of the acts<WH1697> of Solomon,<WH8010> and all that he did,<WH6213> and his wisdom,<WH2451> aren't<WH3789> they written in the book<WH5612> of the acts<WH1697> of Solomon?<WH8010>
The time<WH3117> that Solomon<WH8010> reigned<WH4427> in Jerusalem<WH3389> over all Israel<WH3478> was forty<WH705> years.<WH8141>
Solomon<WH8010> slept<WH7901> with his fathers,<WH1> and was buried<WH6912> in the city<WH5892> of David<WH1732> his father:<WH1> and Rehoboam<WH7346> his son<WH1121> reigned in his place.<WH4427>
